heading: trying to avoid the glitches
subheading: there probably won't be huge disasters as a result of computer glitches, but y2k may bring us many little ones. efforts continue to prevent them. by joanna glasner.
author: joanna glasner
text: it's possible that the year 2000 will arrive without a huge disaster. but judging from early indications, it's likely there will at least be some smaller disasters.the makers of a credit card swipe machine were scrambling wednesday to fix a y2k-type software bug that caused delays for thousands of uk shoppers.a date change recognition problem in the software of as many as 20,000 swipe machines made by racal electronics plc and supplied to merchants by bank group hsbc holdings was behind problems that started on 26 december, causing long lines at checkout counters.merchants trying to swipe charge cards through racal machines for credit authorizations found cards being improperly rejected, forcing them to go through time-consuming telephone authorizations.and elsewhere in the y2k world....
